result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Laughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond applied - paid in full.
Cash bond applied - paid in full.

15C 026790 
Annette J Laughlin 
Refunding balance of cash bond posted.

Defendant Adam J Laughlin in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert. 
Brenda S Freeman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
15CM250 - defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. 
Court accepts plea and finds guilty of Count 1. 
Count 2 dismissed. 
15CM228 - dismissed and read in. 
Court sentences defendant to 10 days jail, running consecutive with jail sentence in 15CT91. 
Court further orders $150 fine plus costs, due in 60 days.
